intro: Brassaiopsis polyacantha var. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman bristle fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. The plant features compound leaves with a serrated margin and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. This variant is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
